ThingShape.description: Processor of pending Timed Service Call queues.
ThingShape.documentationContent:
By default it supposes that this ThingShape it's implemented by a DataTable that has wupServiceCallTimedQueueDS content.

Pending to improve security, as one can execute on another user context the service calls added to the queue, see support case: 12812145

To use this ThingShape, you just need to create a Timer thing which triggers ProcessPendingServiceCalls_wupServiceCallTimedQueueProcessorTS service, and it will consume all pending service calls.
ThingShape.name: wupServiceCallTimedQueueProcessorTS

PropertyDefinition.description: If it's processing, to prevent multiple threads processing the pending events.
PropertyDefinition.name: processing_wupServiceCallTimedQueueProcessorTS

ServiceDefinition.description: Processes pending Service Calls, all the queued service calls <= Now()
ServiceDefinition.name: ProcessPendingServiceCalls_wupServiceCallTimedQueueProcessorTS

FieldDefinition.description: (optional) if you don't pass nothing, it will calculate now as new Date()
FieldDefinition.name: now

FieldDefinition.description: Number of milliseconds to delay the service call.
FieldDefinition.name: milliseconds
